body_html:
@arnaghizadeh : Speaking on behalf of the TensorFlow maintainers: Yes TensorFlow for Swift seems like a very promising avenue which is why we are pursuing it. There is some discussion on the approach described there working for Java in the whitepapers.

That said, this is still a very early stage project with lots of technical details to work though and for now there are no plans to investigate this approach for Java/Kotlin (at least by the TensorFlow maintainers).
body_text:
@arnaghizadeh : Speaking on behalf of the TensorFlow maintainers: Yes TensorFlow for Swift seems like a very promising avenue which is why we are pursuing it. There is some discussion on the approach described there working for Java in the whitepapers.
That said, this is still a very early stage project with lots of technical details to work though and for now there are no plans to investigate this approach for Java/Kotlin (at least by the TensorFlow maintainers).
body:
@arnaghizadeh : Speaking on behalf of the TensorFlow maintainers: Yes TensorFlow for Swift seems like a very promising avenue which is why we are pursuing it. There is some discussion on the approach described there working for Java in [the whitepapers](https://github.com/tensorflow/swift/blob/master/docs/WhySwiftForTensorFlow.md#which-languages-fit-our-project-requirements).

That said, this is still a very early stage project with lots of technical details to work though and for now there are no plans to investigate this approach for Java/Kotlin (at least by the TensorFlow maintainers).
